section.title: Configuring the Monitoring Database Settings
section.para: The monitoring service, based on Monasca, allows you to configure your alarm metrics database should you choose not to use the default option provided with the product.
In &kw-hos-phrase; you have the option to specify a database platform you want to use for the metrics database. These steps will assist in this process.

section.title: Choosing an alarm metrics database option
section.para: The monitoring service supports two different database options. The default metrics database is Vertica, which is a highly-scalable analytics database from HP. Vertica is free to use, up to 12TB, for all paid &productname; customers as a &productname; operational database. Vertica is the recommended database for &kw-hos;.
You can learn more about Vertica here: Vertica Documentation
The alternative open source database option is InfluxDB. InfluxDB is an emerging open source monitoring database, however the current release contains the following limitation:

listitem.para: InfluxDB cluster does not recover upon node failure.

section.para: In order to replace the default database option with InfluxDB as the metrics database, you need to follow these steps:
During the portion of the installation, ensure you make these configuration file edits:

listitem.para: On your &lcm;, edit the following two files:
Edit the ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml file and under your control plane cluster service-clusters section, edit the entry for vertica to read influxdb.

Edit the ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/disks_controller.yml and either replace the existing vertica information or insert the information for InfluxDB as seen below in the section labeled for logical-volumes on the DISK_SET_CONTROLLER:
listitem.screen: - name: influxdb size: 5% mount: /var/opt/influxdb fstype: ext4 mkfs-opts: -O large_file consumer: name: influxdb

listitem.para: Then, edit the file below to change the value of database_type to influxdb instead of vertica:
listitem.screen: # Must be either vertica or influxdb database_type: influxdb

listitem.para: Then continue on with the installation steps as documented.
